posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.51 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Now when you link your primary Signal device to a new Desktop or iPad, you can bring your chat history and your last 45 days of media with you. The transfer process is end-to-end encrypted, and completely optional. When it comes to making the choice about whether or not to leave the past behind, you’re left to your own devices.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.50 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.51.0.671-beta

51 new commits since 7.50.0.658-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.51 [1]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.2 [2]

  • Only auto-set name if we are, in fact, Link'n'Sync-ing [3]

  • Cancel profile refresh when leaving conversation [4]

  • Remove unnecessary CVComponent hooks [5]

  • Remove more CV indirection [6]

  • Download media as it becomes visible in a chat [7]

  • Fix withCooperativeTimeout cancellation handling [8]

  • Remove some unused provisioning code [9]

  • Enable new conversation load index for everyone [10]

  • Remove outdated translation when unregistered [11]

  • Remove unused versionedExpirationTimer capability [12]

  • Exclude pending members from GSE failure check [13]

  • Use web socket when fetching remote configs [14]

  • Don’t return the remote config when refreshing [15]

  • Fix bug where remote config wouldn’t refresh [16]

  • Asyncify some “contact support” flows [17]

  • Remove some places that call userErrorDescription [18]

  • Clean up Safety Number comparison error handling [19]

  • Generalize BGProcessingTaskRunner [20]

  • Add annotations for TSInteraction db indexes [21]

  • Asyncify Stripe methods [22]

  • Fix how chat colors are resolved [23]

  • Rebuild/remove outdated TSInteraction indexes [24]

  • convert AppSetup.prepareDatabase() from promises to swift concurrency [25]

  • remove unnecessary completion hook [26]

  • cleanup simple warnings [27]

  • Remove various TSGroupThread return values [28]

  • Add kill switch for LazyDatabaseMigratorRunner [29]

  • Replace "share" with "save" in context menu for message actions with media [30]

  • Add reserved AccountRecord field we never used [31]

  • Asyncify fetchLocalUsersProfile [32]

  • Remove redundant avatar download invocations [33]

  • Wait for the socket to open in more cases [34]

  • fix warning [35]

  • fix analyze warnings [36]

  • Add system contact names to Backups (#10727) [37]

  • Format phone numbers when used as display names [38]

  • Call fulfill() for ignored CallKit action [39]

  • Update invalid configuration [40]

  • improve regional networking options [41]

  • Use uniform font weight in thread details [42]

  • Sort exact emoji matches first [43]

  • Move QRCodes and util out of Signal/src [44]

  • Fix RemoteConfigManager assertion [45]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.4, stub out server alert support [46]

  • Report networkDidChange event to libsignal even when in the background […] [47]

  • Mitigate unidentified connection assertion [48]

  • Update to libsignal v0.67.5 [49]

  • Revert "Mitigate unidentified connection assertion" […] [50]

  • Update translations [51]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.50.0.658-beta…7.51.0.671-beta

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Hmm, yeah, if you guys need any .IPS logs, I’m bound to have hundreds at this point on my iPad haha

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: Can you (and @Megan) DM me a couple of the .IPS files you have? I’d like to confirm which crash you’re seeing repeatedly.
I don’t have any - sorry - and didn’t have any crashes anymore.

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: Actually, can you send them to support@signal.org and mention that you’re a beta user?

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked: Not sure I understand, do you want me to email them to the email then?? Or were you just telling Megan?

Beta Feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.4 Release

Messages sent in note to self from an iOS device get marked as read immediately, while they aren’t marked as read when sent from a Signal Desktop device:

image640×1136 306 KB

Still there

Summary

20 characters

New Version: 7.51.0.680-beta

4 new commits since 7.51.0.671-beta:

  • Update bank-processing time strings [1]

  • Avoid enqueuing auto-downloads for messages the user manually canceled [2]

  • Update translations [3]

  • Fix malformed translation [4]

posts.name: Max Radermacher
posts.cooked: Are you still seeing this on v7.50 or later? We fixed it here, and I’m no longer able to reproduce this bug.

link_counts.title: Mark Note to Self messages from incoming sync transcripts as read · signalapp/Signal-iOS@0e0f442 · GitHub

posts.cooked: Sorry, with the newest version I just installed it’s indeed fixed.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: I think Max was asking for you both to reach out to support. Please feel free to send them to us in DM as well.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.52 release.
